description: A bearish continuation pattern with flat horizontal support at bottom and descending resistance at top. Shows distribution as sellers become more aggressive while support holds, typically resolves with downside breakdown.

structure: Flat horizontal support at bottom (at least 2 touches)
Descending trendline resistance at top (at least 2 touches, each lower high)
Forms within downtrend for continuation (can reverse uptrend)
Breakdown typically occurs in lower 2/3 of triangle
volume: Volume on declines should exceed rallies (selling dominance)
Strong volume spike on breakdown below support confirms
Low volume during consolidation = distribution phase
indicators: Price should be below key MAs (20/50-day)
RSI staying below 50-60 during rallies shows weakness
MACD staying bearish or weakly bullish
Each rally making lower high = bearish structure
timeframe: Needs proper confirmation on all timeframes

invalidation_signals: Price breaks above descending resistance (bullish reversal)
Volume increasing on rallies vs declines (accumulation)
No volume on breakdown (weak breakdown may fail)
Forms in strong uptrend without prior distribution
common_mistakes: Drawing sloped support when should be flat
Not waiting for close below support

trade_setup.entry: Short on break and close below horizontal support with volume
trade_setup.stop_loss: Above most recent lower high on descending resistance
trade_setup.target: Measure triangle height, subtract from breakdown point
